title: August Kesseler 2017 The Daily August Rosé (Rheingau)
description: Fresh cherry blossom and raspberry perfume is accented by bramble and crushed mineral on the nose of this pretty pale pink rosé. Made from Pinot Noir grapes. Its fresh red cherry and raspberry flavors are cutting and spry. Zesty acidity and firm, stony minerality lend structure to the finish.

title: Black Stallion 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-integrated white wine, made in an unabashedly full-bodied manner that displays ample fruit. Fig, vanilla and a thread of lemon zest give it plenty of flavor and crowd-pleasing personality.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Issos Crianza  (Toro)
description: Leathery berry aromas include exotic notes that stir interest. This feels choppy but also lively and balanced. Cassis, blackberry and plum flavors finish steady. With plenty of ripeness and depth, this manages to show complexity along with elegance. Drink through 2020.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Chêne d'Argent Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This white is rich and creamy, with a slight note of reduction. Decadent in caramel toffee and crème brûlée, it is well made and succulent, allowing the fruit to shine over the well-integrated oak.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2014 Herman Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine offers a deep inviting nose of blackberry cobbler, lavender and violet, the fruit dense and concentrated. There's a lift of freshness on the finish that keeps it alive and balanced in the glass.

title: C. da Silva 2016 Dalva Vintage  (Port)
description: This is an intensely floral wine with bright fruit and fully integrated tannins. It is in a style that brings out acidity and ripe black fruits. With all this fruitiness it will develop quickly. Drink from 2025.

title: Chapel Hill 2017 The Parson G-S-M (McLaren Vale)
description: This is an easygoing, plush, Grenache-led wine, full of juicy strawberry, white pepper, cherry cola and a hint of smoked meat. The region's characteristically sandy tannins shine bright on the palate, which finishes long and savory.

title: Château Guipière 2015 La Tour Vieilles Vignes  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: With age, the concentrated acidity of this wine has softened to reveal the white fruits, generous texture and ripe acidity. The texture is still there, keeping a tight grip on the structure of this well-balanced wine. Drink now.

title: Cristom 2016 Jessie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This is an excellent year for this east-facing block, with bright blackberry and cherry fruit anchored in firm tannins. There's a scent and flavor of chicken stock. Half was whole cluster fermented, and the wine spent 18 months in three-fifths new French oak.

title: Davies 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From fruit grown at both Cuvaison and Hyde vineyards, this is a celebration of the appellation, with pleasing, earthy cardamom and a touch of mint. Dark cherry, vanilla and orange flavors layer around moderate oak and acidity, forming a fruit-friendly complex whole.

title: Domaine Laporte 2017 La Terre des Anges  (Sancerre)
description: This rich, tropical-fruit-flavored wine is generous and full of delicious apricot, mango and pineapple flavors. As a contrast, a strong mineral edge comes from the limestone soil. This is still a young, deliciously fruity wine, but it will be better from 2019.

title: Elio Filippino 2012 San Cristoforo Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, tilled soil, game and eucalyptus. The concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside austere tannins and solid acidity. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Menefee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Amid big changes at this winery (Drew Voit was recently named as the winemaker), this new release is closest to the style for which it has become known. It's an elegant, delightful wine, detailed with fine streaks of cola, cherry, sassafras and baking spices. There's the slightest whiff of chili pepper also. And the finish, integrated with supple tannins, carries another light hint, this one of leather. Drink now–2025.

title: Forget-Brimont 2007 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half-and half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this just-mature wine still has plenty of fruitiness. It's balanced, with hints of toast contrasting with red apples and light spice. Drink this wine now.

title: Fullerton 2016 Lichtenwalter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This vineyard designate is all 777 clone, fermented in rotator barrels and aged in neutral French oak. It follows a consistent style with the winery's other releases, a palate-pleasing mix of Bing cherry, cola, brown spices and a touch of cut tobacco.

title: Kevin White 2016 La Fraternite Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of 64% Upland and Boushey Grenache along with 27% Sugarloaf Mourvèdre and 9% Boushey Syrah, all aged in neutral oak. The aromas are knee buckling, with notes of huckleberry, black raspberry, leather, black pepper, stargazer lily, kirsch and orange peel, showing an outrageous sense of purity. The palate bursts with soft black pepper, smoked meat and red and blue fruit flavors that persist on the finish. It's all about purity, but there's a sense of freshness as well that is thoroughly captivating.

title: Lange 2017 Classique Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Here is an outstanding everyday Chardonnay, both affordable and flavorful. Rich fruit flavors combine melon and peach with a touch of grapefruit. Primarily fermented in stainless steel, but a light hint of oak from a small portion that has been barrel-fermented adds a toasty note to the finish.

title: Lelarge-Pugeot NV Tradition Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: The low dosage that gives the wine its designation as Extra Brut fits well with the rich white fruit of this wine. It has a ripe while very dry character that will be even better as the wine matures for a few more months. Drink this bottling from 2019.

title: McKahn 2016 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Aromas of black pepper and wood smoke meld with rich, concentrated and jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and impressive wine. Aged in 50% new barrels from France and Hungary, It shows plenty of spicy, almost sweet oak character to offset the dense flavors and big structure. Best after 2023.

title: Midnight 2014 Mare Nectaris Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Candied violets, black currant candy, lilac and even a hint of jasmine show on the floral nose of this blend of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 17% Petit Verdot, 8% Malbec and 5% Cabernet Franc. Bright flavors of dark-purple fruit are leveled by a chalky mouthfeel, solid structure and ample acid.
